intro: Vochysia kosnipatae, commonly known as the Andean velvetwood, is a species of flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a small tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture, while its flowers are clustered in inflorescences. Vochysia kosnipatae plays a significant role in its ecosystem, providing habitat and food for various local fauna.
